attributes.action: Insist on the due process of election to decide the next British Prime Minister
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Gordon Brown does not carry the mandate of his own constituency at present, let alone the entire UK, and should not automatically assume to be PM. 
Just one week after the local elections which saw Gordon Brown defeated in his own constituency, it seems that the people of England are about to have a Scot foisted upon them as Prime Minister.
This from a party that has done everything possible to bring about the dissolution of the Union and at a time when Scotland itself has voted for the party that promises to deliver devolution.
Given that NO English MP may vote upon matters purely Scottish within the Scottish parliament, it is wholly wrong that the reverse should be the case.
Gordon Brown, as a Scot, should not automatically be elevated to the position of PM governing the affairs of England. We petition the PM to insist upon an open and fair election process to decide the next PM.
